snippet: Besides a strong rise in earnings, revenue at Lennar jumped 42 percent while orders for homes were up 32 percent.
abstract: Lennar reports sharp rise in quarterly profit and seventh straight increase in new-home orders, further evidence that housing recovery is on track; net income rose to $124.3 million, or 56 cents share, in fourth quarter, from $30.3 million, or 16 cents share, year earlier; revenue rose 42 percent, to $1.3 billion; analysts had expected earnings of 44 cents share on revenue of $1.31 billion.
lead_paragraph: Besides a strong rise in earnings, revenue at Lennar jumped 42 percent while orders for homes were up 32 percent.

headline.main: Lennar Profit Is Up on Housing Recovery
headline.print_headline: Lennar Profit Is Up on Housing Recovery
